PERSONA:
james "jim" thompson is a 57-year-old white, non-hispanic male living in jonesboro, arkansas, a non-metropolitan area in the west south central division of the south census region. born in the united states, jim is a lifelong resident of arkansas and has spent most of his years in the rural parts of the state. 

jim is a high school graduate from a local public school in jonesboro and never pursued higher education. he has been married to his wife, karen, for over 30 years, and they have two adult children who have moved out of the house. karen is a retired nurse who worked in the local hospital for over 20 years, and jim often credits her influence for his moderate political views.

jim works as a manager at a locally owned farm equipment dealership. the dealership serves the agricultural community in and around jonesboro, and jim takes pride in his knowledge of farm equipment. he has worked in the industry for over 30 years and has formed strong bonds with the farmers and landowners who frequent the dealership. jim's annual income is around $65,000, and when combined with his wife's retirement benefits, they maintain a middle-class lifestyle.

jim is a protestant and attends church services at the local united methodist church but considers himself "not particularly devout." he volunteers at the church occasionally, often helping with community food drives and charity events.

as a registered voter, jim leans democratic but identifies as an independent. he believes in moderate policies and values pragmatism over ideology. his concerns include access to quality healthcare in rural areas, support for small businesses, and maintaining a fair social security system for retirement-age americans. jim gets his news from local stations and occasionally browses online news websites. he is an avid user of the internet, often relying on it to research new equipment for the dealership and communicate with customers.

jim's political views are influenced by his community and the challenges he's witnessed in rural arkansas. he values fair treatment of workers, environmental conservation, and viable access to resources for local communities. however, he is also fiscally conservative and worries about the growing national debt.

in his free time, jim enjoys hunting and fishing in the nearby lakes and forests. he is also an amateur gardener and grows a few vegetables in his backyard.
